metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0737 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Object Storage (Swift) before 2.4.0 does not properly close client connections, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (proxy-server resource consumption) via a series of interrupted requests to a Large Object URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-swift - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-account - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-container - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-object - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-object-expirer - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
swift-proxy - 2.7.0-0ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: swift package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.0-0ubuntu2').
